00001 #include "bind.hpp"
00002 #include "ast.hpp"
00003 #include "context.hpp"
00004 #include "eval.hpp"
00005 #include <map>
00006 #include <iostream>
00007 #include <sstream>

00010 namespace Sass {
00011   using namespace std;
00012 
00013   void bind(string callee, Parameters* ps, Arguments* as, Context& ctx, Env* env, Eval* eval)
00014   {
00015     map<string, Parameter*> param_map;
00016 
00017     // Set up a map to ensure named arguments refer to actual parameters. Also
00018     // eval each default value left-to-right, wrt env, populating env as we go.
00019     for (size_t i = 0, L = ps->length(); i < L; ++i) {
00020       Parameter*  p = (*ps)[i];
00021       param_map[p->name()] = p;
00022       // if (p->default_value()) {
00023       //   env->local_frame()[p->name()] = p->default_value()->perform(eval->with(env));
00024       // }
00025     }
00026 
00027     // plug in all args; if we have leftover params, deal with it later
00028     size_t ip = 0, LP = ps->length();
00029     size_t ia = 0, LA = as->length();
00030     while (ia < LA) {
00031       Argument* a = (*as)[ia];
00032       if (ip >= LP) {
00033         // skip empty rest arguments
00034         if (a->is_rest_argument()) {
00035           if (List* l = dynamic_cast<List*>(a->value())) {
00036             if (l->length() == 0) {
00037               ++ ia; continue;
00038             }
00039           }
00040         }
00041         stringstream msg;
00042         msg << callee << " only takes " << LP << " arguments; "
00043             << "given " << LA;
00044         error(msg.str(), as->pstate());
00045       }
00046       Parameter* p = (*ps)[ip];
00047 
00048       // If the current parameter is the rest parameter, process and break the loop
00049       if (p->is_rest_parameter()) {
00050         // The next argument by coincidence provides a rest argument
00051         if (a->is_rest_argument()) {
00052           // We should always get a list for rest arguments
00053           if (List* rest = dynamic_cast<List*>(a->value())) {
00054             // arg contains a list
00055             List* args = rest;
00056             // make sure it's an arglist
00057             if (rest->is_arglist()) {
00058               // can pass it through as it was
00059               env->local_frame()[p->name()] = args;
00060             }
00061             // create a new list and wrap each item as an argument
00062             // otherwise we will not be able to fetch it again
00063             else {
00064               // create a new list object for wrapped items
00065               List* arglist = new (ctx.mem) List(p->pstate(),
00066                                                  0,
00067                                                  rest->separator(),
00068                                                  true);
00069               // wrap each item from list as an argument
00070               for (Expression* item : rest->elements()) {
00071                 (*arglist) << new (ctx.mem) Argument(item->pstate(),
00072                                                      item,
00073                                                      "",
00074                                                      false,
00075                                                      false);
00076               }
00077               // assign new arglist to environment
00078               env->local_frame()[p->name()] = arglist;
00079             }
00080           }
00081           // invalid state
00082           else {
00083             throw runtime_error("invalid state");
00084           }
00085         } else if (a->is_keyword_argument()) {
00086 
00087           // expand keyword arguments into their parameters
00088           List* arglist = new (ctx.mem) List(p->pstate(), 0, List::COMMA, true);
00089           env->local_frame()[p->name()] = arglist;
00090           Map* argmap = static_cast<Map*>(a->value());
00091           for (auto key : argmap->keys()) {
00092             string name = unquote(static_cast<String_Constant*>(key)->value());
00093             (*arglist) << new (ctx.mem) Argument(key->pstate(),
00094                                                  argmap->at(key),
00095                                                  name,
00096                                                  false,
00097                                                  false);
00098           }
00099 
00100         } else {
00101 
00102           // create a new list object for wrapped items
00103           List* arglist = new (ctx.mem) List(p->pstate(),
00104                                              0,
00105                                              List::COMMA,
00106                                              true);
00107           // consume the next args
00108           while (ia < LA) {
00109             // get and post inc
00110             a = (*as)[ia++];
00111             // wrap current argument into new object
00112             (*arglist) << new (ctx.mem) Argument(a->pstate(),
00113                                                  a->value(),
00114                                                  a->name(),
00115                                                  false,
00116                                                  false);
00117             // check if we have rest argument
00118             if (a->is_rest_argument()) {
00119               // preserve the list separator from rest args
00120               if (List* rest = dynamic_cast<List*>(a->value())) {
00121                 arglist->separator(rest->separator());
00122               }
00123               // no more arguments
00124               break;
00125             }
00126           }
00127           // assign new arglist to environment
00128           env->local_frame()[p->name()] = arglist;
00129         }
00130         // consumed parameter
00131         ++ip;
00132         // no more paramaters
00133         break;
00134       }
00135 
00136       // If the current argument is the rest argument, extract a value for processing
00137       else if (a->is_rest_argument()) {
00138         // normal param and rest arg
00139         List* arglist = static_cast<List*>(a->value());
00140         // empty rest arg - treat all args as default values
00141         if (!arglist->length()) {
00142           break;
00143         }
00144         // otherwise move one of the rest args into the param, converting to argument if necessary
00145         if (arglist->is_arglist()) {
00146           a = static_cast<Argument*>((*arglist)[0]);
00147         } else {
00148           Expression* a_to_convert = (*arglist)[0];
00149           a = new (ctx.mem) Argument(a_to_convert->pstate(),
00150                                      a_to_convert,
00151                                      "",
00152                                      false,
00153                                      false);
00154         }
00155         arglist->elements().erase(arglist->elements().begin());
00156         if (!arglist->length() || (!arglist->is_arglist() && ip + 1 == LP)) {
00157           ++ia;
00158         }
00159       } else if (a->is_keyword_argument()) {
00160         Map* argmap = static_cast<Map*>(a->value());
00161 
00162         for (auto key : argmap->keys()) {
00163           string name = "$" + unquote(static_cast<String_Constant*>(key)->value());
00164 
00165           if (!param_map.count(name)) {
00166             stringstream msg;
00167             msg << callee << " has no parameter named " << name;
00168             error(msg.str(), a->pstate());
00169           }
00170           env->local_frame()[name] = argmap->at(key);
00171         }
00172         ++ia;
00173         continue;
00174       } else {
00175         ++ia;
00176       }
00177 
00178       if (a->name().empty()) {
00179         if (env->has_local(p->name())) {
00180           stringstream msg;
00181           msg << "parameter " << p->name()
00182           << " provided more than once in call to " << callee;
00183           error(msg.str(), a->pstate());
00184         }
00185         // ordinal arg -- bind it to the next param
00186         env->local_frame()[p->name()] = a->value();
00187         ++ip;
00188       }
00189       else {
00190         // named arg -- bind it to the appropriately named param
00191         if (!param_map.count(a->name())) {
00192           stringstream msg;
00193           msg << callee << " has no parameter named " << a->name();
00194           error(msg.str(), a->pstate());
00195         }
00196         if (param_map[a->name()]->is_rest_parameter()) {
00197           stringstream msg;
00198           msg << "argument " << a->name() << " of " << callee
00199               << "cannot be used as named argument";
00200           error(msg.str(), a->pstate());
00201         }
00202         if (env->has_local(a->name())) {
00203           stringstream msg;
00204           msg << "parameter " << p->name()
00205               << "provided more than once in call to " << callee;
00206           error(msg.str(), a->pstate());
00207         }
00208         env->local_frame()[a->name()] = a->value();
00209       }
00210     }
00211     // EO while ia
00212 
00213     // If we make it here, we're out of args but may have leftover params.
00214     // That's only okay if they have default values, or were already bound by
00215     // named arguments, or if it's a single rest-param.
00216     for (size_t i = ip; i < LP; ++i) {
00217       To_String to_string(&ctx);
00218       Parameter* leftover = (*ps)[i];
00219       // cerr << "env for default params:" << endl;
00220       // env->print();
00221       // cerr << "********" << endl;
00222       if (!env->has_local(leftover->name())) {
00223         if (leftover->is_rest_parameter()) {
00224           env->local_frame()[leftover->name()] = new (ctx.mem) List(leftover->pstate(),
00225                                                                       0,
00226                                                                       List::COMMA,
00227                                                                       true);
00228         }
00229         else if (leftover->default_value()) {
00230           // make sure to eval the default value in the env that we've been populating
00231           Env* old_env = eval->env;
00232           Backtrace* old_bt = eval->backtrace;
00233           Contextualize* old_context = eval->contextualize;
00234           Expression* dv = leftover->default_value()->perform(eval->with(env, eval->backtrace));
00235           eval->env = old_env;
00236           eval->backtrace = old_bt;
00237           eval->contextualize = old_context;
00238           // dv->perform(&to_string);
00239           env->local_frame()[leftover->name()] = dv;
00240         }
00241         else {
00242           // param is unbound and has no default value -- error
00243           stringstream msg;
00244           msg << "required parameter " << leftover->name()
00245               << " is missing in call to " << callee;
00246           error(msg.str(), as->pstate());
00247         }
00248       }
00249     }
00250 
00251     return;
00252   }
00253
